snippet: Millions of dollars have been injected into Maine’s Senate race, giving fresh hope to the Republican nominee, despite the independent candidate’s persistent lead in the polls.
abstract: More than $6 million in outside money has been injected into Maine’s Senate race, including that from Karl Rove and New York Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, giving fresh hope to Republican nominee Charles Summers, despite independent candidate Angus King’s persistent lead in the polls; national Democrats have kept their distance from party's nominee Cynthia Dill.
lead_paragraph: Millions of dollars have been injected into Maine’s Senate race, giving fresh hope to the Republican nominee, despite the independent candidate’s persistent lead in the polls.

headline.seo: Rove Versus Bloomberg? It Just Seems That Way in Maine
headline.main: Rove vs. Bloomberg? It Seems That Way in Maine Senate Race
headline.print_headline: Rove Vs. Bloomberg? It Seems That Way In Maine Senate Race
